verbose_text: A more common real-world stress is DNA damage, which can trigger processes that result in (a) increased auto-ubiquitination of Mdm2, (b) decreased ubiquitination of p53 by Mdm2 and (c) weaker binding of p53-Mdm2 [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], corresponding in our model to increasing gamma, decreasing delta, and increasing k D.
